verses.text: This know also, that in the last days perilous times shall come.

similars.text: Alas for the day! for the day of the Lord is at hand, and as a destruction from the Almighty shall it come.
Knowing this first, that there shall come in the last days scoffers, walking after their own lusts,
And he shall also write concerning the end of the world.

verses.text: For men shall be lovers of their own selves, covetous, boasters, proud, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, unthankful, unholy,

similars.text: Also of your own selves shall men arise, speaking perverse things, to draw away disciples after them.

verses.text: Without natural affection, trucebreakers, false accusers, incontinent, fierce, despisers of those that are good,
Traitors, heady, highminded, lovers of pleasures more than lovers of God;
Having a form of godliness, but denying the power thereof: from such turn away.
For of this sort are they which creep into houses, and lead captive silly women laden with sins, led away with divers lusts,
Ever learning, and never able to come to the knowledge of the truth.
Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds, reprobate concerning the faith.
But they shall proceed no further: for their folly shall be manifest unto all men, as theirs also was.

similars.text: And if any man shall seek to build up himself, and seeketh not my counsel, he shall have no power, and his folly shall be made manifest.

verses.text: But thou hast fully known my doctrine, manner of life, purpose, faith, longsuffering, charity, patience,

similars.text: I know thy works, and charity, and service, and faith, and thy patience, and thy works; and the last to be more than the first.
Knowing this, that the trying of your faith worketh patience.

I say unto you, if ye have come to a knowledge of the goodness of God, and his matchless power, and his wisdom, and his patience, and his long-suffering towards the children of men; and also, the atonement which has been prepared from the foundation of the world, that thereby salvation might come to him that should put his trust in the Lord, and should be diligent in keeping his commandments, and continue in the faith even unto the end of his life, I mean the life of the mortal body--

verses.text: Persecutions, afflictions, which came unto me at Antioch, at Iconium, at Lystra; what persecutions I endured: but out of them all the Lord delivered me.

similars.text: I, the Lord, have suffered the affliction to come upon them, wherewith they have been afflicted, in consequence of their transgressions;
Many are the afflictions of the righteous: but the Lord delivereth him out of them all.

verses.text: Yea, and all that will live godly in Christ Jesus shall suffer persecution.

similars.text: And the Lord thy God will put all these curses upon thine enemies, and on them that hate thee, which persecuted thee.
And all they who suffer persecution for my name, and endure in faith, though they are called to lay down their lives for my sake yet shall they partake of all this glory.
For behold, the Lord will not suffer that ye shall live and wax strong in your iniquities to destroy his righteous people.
Blessed are they which are persecuted for righteousness' sake: for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

verses.text: But evil men and seducers shall wax worse and worse, deceiving, and being deceived.

similars.text: A righteous man hateth lying: but a wicked man is loathsome, and cometh to shame.

verses.text: But continue thou in the things which thou hast learned and hast been assured of, knowing of whom thou hast learned them;

similars.text: That thou mightest know the certainty of those things, wherein thou hast been instructed.
I have not departed from thy judgments: for thou hast taught me.
Thou hast commanded us to keep thy precepts diligently.
Thou hast seen and heard all this; and will ye not declare them? And that I have showed thee new things from this time, even hidden things, and thou didst not know them.
So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: when thou hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off.
Thou hast heard, see all this; and will not ye declare it? I have shewed thee new things from this time, even hidden things, and thou didst not know them.
What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?
Behold, thou knowest that thou hast inquired of me and I did enlighten thy mind; and now I tell thee these things that thou mayest know that thou hast been enlightened by the Spirit of truth;
Write the things which thou hast seen, and the things which are, and the things which shall be hereafter;
That thou mightest know the certainty of those things, wherein thou hast been instructed.
Therefore, declare the things which ye have heard, and verily believe, and know to be true.

verses.text: And that from a child thou hast known the holy scriptures, which are able to make thee wise unto salvation through faith which is in Christ Jesus.
All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness:
That the man of God may be perfect, throughly furnished unto all good works.

similars.text: And may God grant, in his great fulness, that men might be brought unto repentance and good works, that they might be restored unto grace for grace, according to their works.
That ye might walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing, being fruitful in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God;
Make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
For there is a time appointed for every man, according as his works shall be.

Therefore, I would that ye should be steadfast and immovable, always abounding in good works, that Christ, the Lord God Omnipotent, may seal you his, that you may be brought to heaven, that ye may have everlasting salvation and eternal life, through the wisdom, and power, and justice, and mercy of him who created all things, in heaven and in earth, who is God above all. Amen.

And it is requisite with the justice of God that men should be judged according to their works; and if their works were good in this life, and the desires of their hearts were good, that they should also, at the last day, be restored unto that which is good.
Knowing that whatsoever good thing any man doeth, the same shall he receive of the Lord, whether he be bond or free.
For by one offering he hath perfected for ever them that are sanctified.
And God is able to make all grace abound toward you; that ye, always having all sufficiency in all things, may abound to every good work:

And for his love he shall be great, for he shall be mine if he do this, saith the Lord. I have seen the work which he hath done, which I accept if he continue, and will crown him with blessings and great glory.
Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?
Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?
Therefore I would that ye should be perfect even as I, or your Father who is in heaven is perfect.

O how great the plan of our God! For on the other hand, the paradise of God must deliver up the spirits of the righteous, and the grave deliver up the body of the righteous; and the spirit and the body is restored to itself again, and all men become incorruptible, and immortal, and they are living souls, having a perfect knowledge like unto us in the flesh, save it be that our knowledge shall be perfect.
He hath made his wonderful works to be remembered: the Lord is gracious and full of compassion.
Seest thou how faith wrought with his works, and by works was faith made perfect?
Make you perfect in every good work to do his will, working in you that which is wellpleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.
That ye might walk worthy of the Lord unto all pleasing, being fruitful in every good work, and increasing in the knowledge of God;
